data.title: Isaías Violante cumple el deseo a su padre fallecido al ser campeón de Liga MX con Toluca
data.description: "Estoy tranquilo porque sé que me va a ver, espero darle esa alegría desde allá", expresó Isaías Violante en una entrevista cuando se le preguntó acerca de su padre que falleció un par de años atrás. Aunque hoy su figura paterna no está en el plano terrenal, el número 12 de los Diablos Rojos del Toluca tiene la certeza de que lo vio levantar su primer título de Liga MX.Isaías Violante es un muchacho humilde, pero a sus 21 años ya tiene una carrera sólida en con Toluca: dos títulos en categorías inferiores y uno con la mayor.Su debut ocurrió en la jornada 14 del Guard1anes 2020 frente a los Pumas. Aunque solo disputó cuatro minutos en CU, el objetivo estaba hecho y todo gracias al esfuerzo, la humildad y el trabajo en el día a día, valores que le fueron inculcados por su familia.Forjado en casaViolante Romero nació en Veracruz el 20 de octubre de 2003. Desde los tres años empezó a jugar al futbol en un equipo que dirigía su tío, y paulatinamente fue incrementando la dificultad conforme creía, al grado de que disputó torneos nacionales en su niñez.Llegó a la cantera del Toluca a los 15 años y en su primer torneo registrado en la Sub 15, en el Apertura 2018, jugó 16 partidos y marcó ocho goles. El salto a la Sub 17 lo hizo un año después, donde jugó tres torneos antes de pasar a la 20 en el Apertura 2020.Con 16 años llenó el ojo de Carlos Morales, el entonces entrenador del primer equipo, y lo convocó para el partido contra Pumas en la jornada 14, luego sumó 45 minutos ante los Rayos del Necaxa en el Estadio Victoria.Aunque rolaba actividad entre la Sub 17, 18, 20 y tercera división, el primer equipo no le perdía el ojo y lo mantenía en los entrenamientos, pues era necesario que puliera sus habilidades como lateral.Pese a esto, no había duda de sus habilidades: la rapidez con y sin pelota, el regate, buena definición dentro y fuera del área, y la capacidad para asistir a sus compañeros por la banda izquierda. Esto le valió ser convocado con el Tri en dos ocasiones, ganando el bicampeonato de la Revelations Cup.Regresó a la primera división en el Clausura 2022 y marcó su primer gol ante Atlas en la jornada 16. Camilo Vargas achicó para intentar presionar al joven canterano, pero este definió con clase al bombear la pelota con un sutil toque con la punta de la zurda.Cumplir el sueño de su padrePara las siguientes campañas alternó tanto en el primer equipo y con la Sub 20, con la cual logró el campeonato en el Clausura 2023 ante América. También formó parte del Torneo Maurice Revello y los Juegos Centroamericanos y del Caribe,en los que logró el subcampeonato y la medalla de oro, respectivamente.Dependiendo de las necesidades de los entrenadores, Violante alternaba de posiciones, entre lateral y extremo. Tanto Ignacio Ambriz como Renato Paiva llegaron a usarlo como lateral más que como extremo, incluso eso pasó con la selección en algunos encuentros. Esto lo ayudó a ser más polifuncional, a corresponder a las exigencias del banquillo y mantener los pies en la tierra.Su torneo de consolidación llegó en el Apertura 2024, donde Renato Paiva lo puso a jugar en 15 ocasiones (12 como titular) y anotó cuatro goles, entre los cuales destacó el doblete que le marcó al Atlas en el Nemesio Diez. Estos números le ayudaron a conseguir un contrato a nivel del primer equipo y ser registrado con número de primera.Con la llegada de Antonio Mohamed siguió siendo recurrente en Liga. Jugó en 16 partidos (12 de temporada regular y 4 en liguilla), aunque solo en tres fue titular. Con la Sub 23 logró el campeonato al vencer a FC Juárez en el Nemesio Diez, un presagio de lo que sucedió semanas después con el primer equipo.Otros equipos ya le pusieron el ojo, América y Chivas, por ejemplo, llegaron a preguntar por él en torneos pasados, lo que muestra el techo alto que puede alcanzar con apenas 21 años.La dorsal 12, un número especialCuando Toluca le ofreció un nuevo contrato, Violante no dudó en tomar el dorsal 12. En una entrevista con TUDN dijo que tomó esta decisión porque su padre --de quien dicen que es una copia exacta-- usaba ese número."Mi papá falleció hace unos años, ese era el número que siempre usaba donde jugara y a mí también me lo ponían de chico porque decían que era el mini él. Ahora que se pudo hacer lo de la renovación no la pensé y tomé ese número que intentaré llevar con orgullo hasta el cielo"."Yo creo que [le] hubiera gustado verme campeón, me vio debutar, pero ya no me pudo ver ahora que me consolidé, meter más goles, más asistencias, ser un poco más importante en el equipo, ser campeón y estar en los mejores equipos de otros países", sentenció.RGS
data.translatedTitle: Isaiah Violante fulfills the desire to his deceased father by being champion of Liga MX with Toluca
data.translatedDescription: "I am calm because I know he is going to see me, I hope to give him that joy from there," Isaiah said Violante in an interview when he was asked about his father who died a couple of years ago. Although today his father figure is not on the earthly plane, the number 12 of the Red Devils of the Toluca has the certainty that he saw him lift his first MX League title. Violante is a humble boy, but at 21 he already has a solid race in Toluca: two titles in lower categories and one with the older one. Although he only played four minutes in Cu, the goal was done and all thanks to effort, humility and work on a day -to -day basis, values ​​that were instilled by his family. Focus on Casaviolante Romero was born in Veracruz on October 20, 2003. From the three years he began playing football in a team that directed his uncle, and gradually he was increasing the difficulty as he believed, he Nationals in his childhood. The jump to the Sub 17 did it a year later, where he played three tournaments before moving to the 20th in Opening 2020. With 16 years he filled the eye of Carlos Morales, the then coach of the first team, and summoned him for the match against Pumas on day 14, then added 45 minutes to the Necaxa rays at the Victoria Stadium. Along He lost his eye and kept it in training, because it was necessary for him to polish his skills as a lateral. Weigh to this, there was no doubt about his skills: the speed with and without ball, the dribbling, good definition inside and outside the area, and the ability to attend his classmates by the left wing. This earned him to be summoned with the TRI on two occasions, winning the two -time Bicampeonato of the Revelation Cup. Campaigns alternated both in the first team and with the Sub 20, with which he achieved the championship in Clausura 2023 against America. He was also part of the Maurice Revelllo tournament and the Central American and Caribbean games, in which he achieved the runner -up and the gold medal, respectively. Depending on the needs of the coaches, Violante alternated positions, between side and end. Both Ignacio Ambriz and Renato Paiva came to use it as a side more than as an extreme, even that happened with the selection in some meetings. This helped him be more polyifunctional, to correspond to the demands of the bench and keep his feet on the ground. His consolidation tournament came in Opening 2024, where Renato Paiva put him to play 15 times (12 as a starter) and scored four goals, among which he highlighted the double that marked Atlas in Nemesio Diez. These numbers helped him get a contract at the level of the first team and be registered with First number. With the arrival of Antonio Mohamed, he remained recurrent in the League. He played in 16 games (12 regular season and 4 in Liguilla), although only in three he started. With the Sub 23 he achieved the championship by beating FC Juárez in Nemesio Diez, an omen of what happened weeks later with the first team. Other teams already put his eye, America and Chivas, for example, they came to ask for him in past tournaments, which shows the high ceiling he can reach with just 21 years. The Dorsal 12, a special number when Toluca offered him a new contract, he did not hesitate The dorsal 12. In an interview with Tudn he said that he made this decision because his father-who they say is an exact copy-used that number. "My dad died a few years ago, that was the number that I always used where I played and they also put it as a boy because they said it was the mini. [I would have liked to see me champion, I saw me debut, but I couldn't see me now that I consolidated, put more goals, more assists, be a little more important in the team, be champion and be in the best teams in other countries, "he said.

data.title: ANAC rechaza impuesto del 3.5 por ciento a remesas y plantea a CSP un plan emergente
data.description: La Asociación Nacional de Alcaldes del CEN PAN cuestionó la debilidad diplomática del gobierno federal de Morena, para frenar el nuevo arancel a las remesas que llegan a México, aprobado por el Congreso de Estados Unidos ante la pasividad de la Federación.Mauricio Tabe Echartea, presidente de la ANAC, dijo que no es con marchas ni concentraciones en el Zócalo como se responde a Estados Unidos ante esta afrenta, sino que con una verdadera política humana y social.“Habrá menos ingresos para las familias, más sufrimiento y mayores complicaciones patrimoniales, así como afectaciones a los derechos humanos”.“Insistimos que no al populismo; el PAN se ofrece como un puente con la Iniciativa Privada para valorar esquemas de ayuda a familias de migrantes mexicanos que ahora, recibirán un golpe a su economía por este impuesto arbitrario de Estados Unidos”, expresó.​​La política exterior le queda grande a MéxicoTabe expresó que a México le ha quedado grande la política exterior y la 4T no sabe hacer diplomacia en Washington porque somos ninguneos.Miguel Ángel Varela Pinedo, vicepresidente de asuntos migrantes de la Asociación Nacional de Alcaldes, manifestó que este impuesto es un fracaso más a la política exterior de México.“Hay ausencia del canciller en Estados Unidos y una falta de pericia del embajador en Washington, no basta con sólo mandar cartas para frenar la amenaza de las remesas, es con acciones”.Por ello, los panistas anunciaron que vía el PAN en San Lázaro y en el Senado, plantearan un paquete de legislaciones para facilitar estímulos fiscales a empresas que reduzcan sus costos en productos de despensa y servicios para familias de migrantes.“Y el gobierno sea corresponsable de estas acciones, facilitando también esquemas de vivienda y alimentación, así como educación para aminorar los golpes; a Morena le quedo grande la política exterior”.
data.translatedTitle: ANAC rejects 3.5 percent tax to remittances and raises CSP an emerging plan
data.translatedDescription: The National Association of Mayors of CEN PAN questioned the diplomatic weakness of the Federal Government of Morena, to stop the new tariff to the remittances that arrive in Mexico, approved by the United States Congress before the passivity of the Federation. data.title: Toluca, el 'coco' del América que afianza su hegemonía en las liguillas de la Liga MX
data.description: Toluca lo hizo de nuevo, se impuso ante América y se consolidó como el equipo que más veces ha derrotado a las Águilas en las liguillas. En esta ocasión el triunfo les valió levantar su undécimo título de Liga MX en la final del Clausura 2025.Los Diablos hicieron lo que Tigres, Cruz Azul y Monterrey no lograron: terminar la hegemonía de un equipo de época, un América que con André Jardine no se cansó de ganar títulos, que se acostumbró a ganar finales, que jugando bien o mal siempre impuso la mística azulcrema.Hoy Toluca puede presumir,que fue el verdugo del América y que, si los hombres clave como Alexis Vega, Paulinho, Marcel Ruiz y Jesús Gallardo siguen al frente de Antonio Mohamed, pueden cosechar más títulos.Verano 1998, el inicio del dominioAmérica inauguró la rivalidad en liguillas con dos victorias: la primera fue en la final de la temporada 1970-1971 y la segunda en la temporada 1989-1990 en los cuartos de final.Ocho años después, los Diablos Rojos se impusieron ante las Águilas en la ronda de semifinales. Enrique Alfaro puso el único gol de la ida, mientras que José Manuel Abundis y Fabian Estay se vistieron de héroes para llevar al Toluca a romper la sequía de 28 años sin título.Después de esta serie, los Choriceros se impusieron en otras cuatro ocasiones. En Invierno 2000 se citaron en los cuartos de final, Toluca llegó como el sublíder general, mientras que América culminó séptimo. En la ida Cardozo y Morales silenciaron el Azteca, en la vuelta el América igualó el global, pero la posición en la tabla benefició a los mexiquenses.En 2004 volvieron a encontrarse en cuartos, donde ahora la ida se jugó en el Nemesio Diez. Paulo Da Silva y Uzziel Lozano neutralizaron a las Águilas, y en la vuelta Israel López mandó a la visita a semis, donde perdieron ante Chivas.En el Bicentenario 2010 (torneo en el que Toluca quedó campeón por última ocasión) volvieron a enfrentarse en cuartos. El empate a dos en la ida puso a los Choriceros con los pelos de punta, pero volvieron a imponerse en casa con goles de Sinha y Manuel Pérez.Y la última de esta seguidilla de triunfos fue en las semis del Apertura 2012. Toluca ganó la ida por 0-2 en el Azteca; América triunfó en la vuelta por 1-2, pero no fue suficiente para remontar el marcador global. En ese torneo, los Diablos perdieron ante Tijuana en la final.El 'coco' de las liguillasDespués de la serie en 2012 se volvieron a enfrentar en cinco ocasiones, en las cuales tres fueron a favor de América: Apertura 2013, Apertura 2018 y Apertura 2024. Lo curioso es que en esas tres ocasiones las Águilas terminó en la final y en dos ganaron el título.El Apertura 2022 significó la sexta victoria de los Choriceros ante los Azulcrema, ahora en una serie de semifinales. Ortega y Leo López dieron la ventaja en casa, para que el gol de Torres Nilo en el Coloso de Santa Úrsula fuera suficiente para eliminarlos.Lo curioso es que de las siete ocasiones en las que Toluca se impuso, en cinco las ganó cerrando como local, lo que refleja que el Nemesio Diez es un estadio que se le complica al América, y que volvió a suceder en este Clausura 2025.​​RGS

data.title: Alexis Vega, el hincha de Cruz Azul que alcanzó la gloria con Toluca
data.description:
Hay futbolistas que alcanzan a cumplir sus sueños en el profesionalismo, aunque quizá no como lo planearon, o como lo esperaban, pero sí como debió ser... a lo grande.Alexis Vega es una de las mejores historias de idolatría para la afición del Toluca, pues en el presente Clausura 2025 se convirtió en uno de los referentes de la escuadra dirigida por Antonio Mohamed, pero también en uno de los consentidos por los hinchas de los Diablos Rojos.Incluso, Vega fue uno de los pilares en la final disputada ante América para alcanzar el campeonato de la Liga MX con el club de sus amores.Sin embargo, esta historia no siempre estuvo escrita así, pues cuando era pequeño Alexis Vega era hincha de otro equipo, uno de gran historia y tradición en el futbol mexicano; Cruz Azul."En ese tiempo toda mi familia le iba a Cruz Azul. Tenía amigos de mis primos y amigos míos que eran aficionados de Cruz Azul. Un mismo tío me llevaba al estadio a los 15 años", mencionó en un podcast el pasado 2023.Este titulo es por ti y para ti Cruz Azul.-Alexis Vega Chiquito. pic.twitter.com/FssZKomZcq— Futbol Gourmet (@Futbol_Gourmet) May 26, 2025


​Incluso, Alexis Vega llegó a integrarse a una de las porras de la escuadra cementera, pues era un fiel aficionado."Comprábamos nuestro boleto y nos metíamos con la barra de Cruz Azul. Duré como un año y medio siendo de la barra de Cruz Azul. Era un pinche aficionado que me quitaba la playera, cantaba, los mosaicos en los estadios, sin playera y lloviendo", mencionó.No obstante, Alexis Vega no ha vestido los colores de La Máquina en la Liga MX, aunque ha estado cerca, por lo que fue con el Toluca con quien reconectó con la afición y alcanzó la gloria.​FCM
data.translatedTitle: Alexis Vega, the Blue Cruz fan that reached glory with Toluca
data.translatedDescription:
There are players who manage to fulfill their dreams in professionalism, although perhaps not as they planned it, or as expected, but as it should have been ... to the big. Alexis Vega is one of the best stories of idolatry for the fans of Toluca, because in this closing 2025 it became one of the referents of the squad directed by Antonio Mohamed, but also in one of the fans of the fans of the fans Red Devils. Included, Vega was one of the pillars in the final played against America to reach the MX League championship with the club of his loves. However, this story was not always written like this, because when I was little Alexis Vega was a fan of another team, one of great history and tradition in Mexican football; Cruz Azul. "At that time my whole family went to Cruz Azul. I had friends with my cousins ​​and my friends who were fans of Cruz Azul. The same uncle took me to the stadium at age 15," he mentioned in a podcast the past 2023. This title is for you and for you Cruz Azul.-Alexis Vega Chiquito. pic.twitter.com/fsszkomzcq— Gourmet soccer (@futbol_gourmet) May 26, 2025


Even, Alexis Vega came to join one of the batons of the cement squad, because he was an amateur Vega has not dressed the colors of the machine in the MX League, although it has been close, so it was with the Toluca who reconnected with the fans and reached glory. FCM

data.title: Tiroteo en Carolina del Sur deja al menos 11 heridos
data.description: Al menos 11 personas fueron trasladadas a hospitales después de un tiroteo este domingo por la noche en un pueblo costero de Carolina del Sur, dijeron las autoridades.La policía del condado de Horry no proporcionó las condiciones de las personas heridas en el tiroteo que ocurrió alrededor de las 21:30 (hora local) en Little River.Los investigadores recibieron informes de más personas que llegaban al hospital en vehículos privados, dijo la policía del Condado de Horry en las redes sociales.Las autoridades no dieron a conocer ninguna información sobre posibles sospechosos ni sobre las causas del tiroteo.Little River está a unos 21 kilómetros al noreste de Myrtle Beach.Noticia en desarrollo. Sigue conectado en la multiplataforma Milenio para mantenerte al tanto de la última hora sobre esta información. data.title: ¿Polémica? Así fue el penal que otorgó César Ramos al Toluca en la final contra América | VIDEO
data.description:
Toluca encontró el segundo gol contra América en la final del torneo Clausura 2025 con un penal que cometió Sebastián Cáceres a Robert Morales en la segunda mitad.El paraguayo entró en la segunda mitad para sustituir a Paulinho, quien tuvo que salir del terreno de juego por una lesión muscular. De hecho el portugués no jugó la ida por estas molestias y estuvo en duda para la vuelta.Pero Morales entró con todo al terreno de juego y, en un contragolpe por la banda derecha, entró al área en conducción de balón y se dispuso a disparar, por lo que Cáceres tuvo que barrerse.Para la mala fortuna del central, su pie alcanza a cometer una zancadilla a Morales. César Ramos se percató gracias a la ayuda de su asistente y marcó la pena máxima.No podía ser otro... ????????¡¡ALEXIS VEGA TRAE LA 11 DESDE LOS 11 PASOS!! #LaSeñalDelCampeon???????????? @Canal_Estrellas TUDN y ViX pic.twitter.com/cgcaNIrO5V— TUDN MEX (@TUDNMEX) May 26, 2025


El VAR hizo la revisión silenciosa, pero después de unos minutos dio el visto bueno y Ramos Palazuelos dejó que Alexis Vega pusiera la pelota en el manchón penal.Con la derecha, Vega tiró al poste izquierdo de Malagón, quien aguantó para adivinar sin éxito hacia dónde iba el disparo. Gracias a este gol, los Diablos Rojos lograron su undécimo trofeo de la Liga MX y terminó la hegemonía del América.Ex árbitros opinan del penal de Cáceres a MoralesLos ex árbitros de la Liga MX no tardaron en reaccionar a la jugada de Sebastián Cáceres y explican que hubo un contacto al balón previo a la zancadilla. Felipe Ramos Rizo, por ejemplo, criticó al VAR por no llamar a Ramos Rizo a ver la repetición.Por su parte, Fernando Guerrero también tundió al videoarbitraje por no llamar al árbitro e incluso dijo que este tipo de errores ocurrieron a lo largo de la temporada.#aChiquiVAR A golpe de vista Penal!!Con el beneficio de la repetición es penal!!César Ramos no es responsable del deficiente rendimiento arbitral del partido de ida.Efectivamente en la ida hubo dos penales a favor del @ClubAmerica .El @TolucaFC el mejor equipo del torneo… pic.twitter.com/W49zhUNibz— Arbitro Entrenador (@ChiquimarcoMx) May 26, 2025


Mientras que Marco Antonio Rodríguez va en contra de sus ex colegas y dice que no es penal. "César Ramos es el mejor y el VAR con Pacheco le validó correctamente.El efecto óptico engaña a inexpertos y tendenciosos analistas, quieren ver un toque de balón del defensor águila", escribió en su cuenta de X.​​
data.translatedTitle: Controversy? This was the penalty granted César Ramos al Toluca in the final against America | VIDEO
data.translatedDescription:
Toluca found the second goal against America in the final of the Clausura 2025 tournament with a penalty committed by Sebastián Cáceres to Robert Morales in the second half. Paraguayan entered the second half to replace Paulinho, who had to leave the pitch with a muscle injury. In fact, the Portuguese did not play the first leg for these discomforts and was in doubt for the return. But Morales entered with everything to the pitch and, in a backlash on the right wing, entered the ball in ball driving and set out to shoot, so that Cáceres had to sweep it. For the bad fortune of the central, his foot reaches to commit a zancadilla to Morales. César Ramos noticed thanks to the help of his assistant and marked the maximum penalty. It could not be another ... ??????? ¡Alexis Vega brings the 11 from the 11 steps !! #Lasañaldelcampeon ???????????? @Canal_estrellas tudn and vix pic.twitter.com/cgcaniro5v— tudn mex (@tudnmex) May 26, 2025


The VAR did the silent review, but after a few minutes he was approved and Ramos Palazuelos let Alexis Vega put the ball in the criminal spot. With the right, Vega threw Malaga's left post, who endured to guess without success where the shot was going. Thanks to this goal, the Red Devils achieved their eleventh Trophy of the MX League and ended the hegemony of America. Ade arbitrators think of the Cáceres prison to Moraleslos former arbitrators of the MX League soon they did not take to react to Sebastián Cáceres's play and explain that there was a contact to the ball prior to the zancadilla. Felipe Ramos Rizo, for example, criticized VAR for not calling Ramos Riz In the first leg there were two penalties in favor of @Clubamerica .el @toluccafc the best team in the tournament ... pic.twitter.com/w49zhunibz— Coach Referee (@chiquimarcomx) May 26, 2025


While Marco Antonio Rodríguez goes against his former colleagues and says he is not criminal. "César Ramos is the best and the VAR with Pacheco validated him correctly. The optical effect deceives inexperienced and tendentious analysts, they want to see a touch of the Eagle defender's ball," he wrote in his X account.

data.title: 2025, o ano da grande fome

data.title: A revolução do óbvio
data.description: Um confiável termômetro sobre o desatino de uma época é a capacidade de seus contemporâneos de se entorpecerem diante de uma simples obviedade. Se, como reza o ditado, em terra de cego quem tem olho é rei, vale acrescentar que, em palco de maluco, quem junta lé com cré vira gênio. Em tempos normais, o óbvio só consegue ser banal. Mas, na era do descalabro, o truísmo pode adquirir status de verdade revelada. Nessa segunda categoria se insere a pregação de Abigail Disney , herdeira de fortuna e sobrenome que dispensam apresentações. Em entrevista à Folha ("Precisamos parar de idolatrar os ricos, diz herdeira da Disney ", 5/5), a cineasta filantropa, que visitou o Brasil recentemente, disse algo que vem a calhar nestes tempos aziagos. Segundo ela, o mundo precisa parar de idolatrar os ricos, achando que eles sabem mais. Atentemo-nos: cifras demais não necessariamente são neurônios a mais. Leia mais (05/25/2025 - 22h00)
data.translatedTitle: The Obvious Revolution
data.translatedDescription: A reliable thermometer about the dispute of an era is the ability of its contemporaries to numb before a simple obviousness. If, as the saying goes, on the ground of blind who has an eye is king, it is worth adding that, on the crazy stage, who joins lé with credit becomes genius. In normal times, the obvious can only be banal. But in the era of the decalabro, truism can acquire true status. This second category includes the preaching of Abigail Disney, heiress of fortune and surname that dispense with presentations. In an interview with Folha ("we need to stop idolizing the rich, says heiress of Disney," 5/5), the philanthropa filmmaker, who recently visited Brazil, said something that comes in these times. According to her, the world needs to stop idolizing the rich, thinking they know more. We be aware: Too many numbers are not necessarily more neurons. Read more (05/25/2025 - 22h00)

data.title: Brasil e Itália se unem em feira de negócios do vinho no Sul
data.description: O vinho brasileiro, na sua alma, é italiano. Na maior parte dos casos, é produzido por famílias descendentes de italianos da Serra Gaúcha, uma região que, 150 anos após o início da imigração italiana, ainda guarda muitas tradições do país de origem de seus colonos. Por lá, a comida ainda é massa, frango e polenta. Ainda se fala o talian (uma língua que surgiu na região a partir da mistura de dialetos vênetos e português). O vinho ainda está presente na mesa em todas as refeições. Leia mais (05/25/2025 - 12h45)
data.translatedTitle: Brazil and Italy unite at the Wine Business Fair in the South
data.translatedDescription: Brazilian wine, in your soul, is Italian. In most cases, it is produced by descendant families of Italians of Serra Gaucha, a region that, 150 years after the beginning of Italian immigration, still holds many traditions from the country of origin of its settlers. There, the food is still mass, chicken and polenta. The Talian is still spoken (a language that emerged in the region from the mix of vendnet and Portuguese dialects). The wine is still present at the table in all meals. Read more (05/25/2025 - 12h45)

data.title: PM in Turkiye to ‘elevate strategic partnership’
data.description: • Shehbaz meets Erdogan, expresses gratitude for Ankara’s support during tensions with India • Both sides reaffirm principled support for ‘core concerns’, including Kashmir dispute; call for Gaza ceasefire • Premier advocates investments in renewable energy, IT, defence production, agriculture ISLAMABAD: In the first leg of his four-country tour, Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Sunday arrived in Turkiye, where he met President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to not only thank Ankara for its support during recent tensions with India but also cement bilateral economic cooperation. “Both leaders reaffirmed their principled support for each other’s core concerns, including the Jammu and Kashmir dispute,” said an official press release issued by the Prime Minister’s Office on Sunday. In his meeting with President Erdogan, the PM advocated joint ventures and enhanced bilateral investment, highlighting key sectors, including renewable energy, information technology, defence production, infrastructure development, and agriculture as potential areas of mutual interest. The two leaders also conducted a comprehensive review of the entire spectrum of bilateral relations and reiterated their resolve to elevate the strategic partnership. They also followed up on the implementation of key decisions taken during the 7th session of the High-Level Strategic Cooperation Council (HLSCC), held in Islamabad on Feb 13 this year. Both sides agreed to take steps to achieve the $5 billion annual bilateral trade target agreed earlier by the two leaders. In addition to bilateral issues, Prime Minister Shehbaz and President Erdogan discussed pressing regional and international developments. They also expressed concern over the grave humanitarian situation in Gaza, urgently calling for an immediate ceasefire and unimpeded humanitarian access to the affected Palestinian population. PM Shehbaz, who was accompanied by Chief of Army Staff (COAS) Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, expressed heartfelt gratitude to the government and people of Turkiye for their unwavering support to Pakistan during the recent developments in South Asia. He lauded Turkiye’s principled stance and the outpouring support of goodwill of the Turkish people for Pakistan and termed it as a source of great comfort and strength for Pakistan. The premier highlighted the commitment, courage and the spirit of sacrifice of the armed forces of Pakistan and the resolute patriotism that was demonstrated in an unprecedented manner, which contributed to Pakistan’s victory in Marak-i-Haq and Operation Bunyanum Marsoos . According to state-run PTV News , Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar, Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, Information Minis­ter Attaullah Tarar, and Special Assistant Syed Tariq Fatemi also participated in the meeting. Moreover, both leaders also presided over a delegation-level meeting between the two sides. Earlier, on his arrival at the airport, the PM was received by Defence Minister Yashar Guler, Istanbul Deputy Governor Erdogan Turan Ermis, Pakistan’s ambassador in Turkiye Yousaf Junaid, Consul General Istanbul Nouman Aslam, and other diplomats. After the two-day Turkiye visit, Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif will also visit Iran, Azerbaijan and Tajikistan during this week. During the visits, he is expected to hold “wide-ranging discussions” with the nations while acknowledging their support during Pakistan’s recent escalation with India. According to Dawn.com , in Tajikistan — likely the last leg of his tour — the premier will also attend the International Confe­rence on Glaciers being held in its capital, Dus­hanbe, on May 29 and 30. The visit comes a fortnight after Pakistan and India reached a US-brokered ceasefire following a brief military confrontation. During the conflict, the Iranian foreign minister visited both nations to act as a mediator . According to the FO’s statement, the PM will have “wide-ranging discussions” with the leaders of the four countries on issues including bilateral relations and matters of regional and international importance. Pakistan, Uzbekistan ties Earlier, Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Mini­ster Mohammad Ishaq Dar and Uzbekistan’s Foreign Minister Saidov Bakhtiyor Odilovich discussed bilateral relations and the Uzbekistan-Afghanistan-Pakistan (UAP) Railway Line Project in a phone call on Sunday, the Foreign Office said in a press release . During the conversation, the two leaders expressed optimism about the early finalisation of the framework agreement for the regional connectivity project. The ministers also exchanged views on the regional situation, according to the statement. Published in Dawn, May 26th, 2025

data.title: 110,000 refugees in Pakistan have high-risk profiles: UNHCR
data.description: ISLAMABAD: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) office has said some 110,000 refugees and asylum-seekers in Pakistan, including a minimum of 8 per cent of Proof of Registration (PoR) cardholders, have both high-risk profiles with increased international protection needs, and specific or cumulative vulnerabilities that could qualify them for resettlement. The Resettlement Programme in Pakistan has been active since the 1980s and more than 20,000 vulnerable refugees have now departed for resettlement to third countries to find safety and rebuild their lives, UNHCR says in its latest resettlement factsheet on Pakistan Operation. In 2021, following the changed situation in Afghanistan, there was a renewed interest by the international community in the resettlement of Afghan refugees, leading to an increase in resettlement quotas for Afghan refugees in Pakistan. The US topped the list of nine countries that accepted Afghan refugees for resettlement. The US accepted 10,823 Afghan refugees, followed by Australia (4,362), Canada (2,253), the United Kingdom (954), New Zealand (817), Norway (248), Sweden (182), Finland (116), and Italy (72). Over 300,000 Afghans returned, deported by Pakistan, Iran in a month, says IFRC Since 2021, several diplomatic missions in Pakistan established their own “Safe Passage” programmes to facilitate the evacuation and relocation of Afghan nationals affiliated with their foreign missions in Afgha­nistan, they are outside the framework of UNHCR’s Resettle­ment Programme, the agency clarified. “Resettlement is unique in that it is the only durable solution that involves the relocation of refugees from an asylum country to a third country,” the UNHCR said. Those prioritised include survivors of violence, vulnerable women and girls, at-risk children, and individuals with serious medical conditions. Worsening crisis Meanwhile, the International Federation of Red Cross (IFRC) warned that Afghanistan’s humanitarian crisis — marked by extreme poverty, food insecurity, and a strained health system — is worsening due to a mass influx of returnees, largely triggered by Pakistan’s Illegal Foreigners Repatriation Plan (IFRP). “This influx of Afghan nationals has put further strain on an already fragile infrastructure, complicating efforts to provide essential services to those in need,” the IFRC said. Last month, the IFRC launched a Federation-wide Emergency Appeal in response to escalating humanitarian needs, seeking 25 million Swiss francs to scale up multi-sectoral immediate and longer-term assistance. In April, over 144,500 people returned from Pakistan, with more than 29,900 deported. “During the month of April, between 4,000 and 6,000 people were arriving in Afgha­nistan each day,” the IFRC reported. The influx of returnees, amidst persistent drought, pre-existing internal displacements, and deteriorating economic conditions, is placing immense pressure on already overstretched services. Adding to the pressure, returns from Iran are also increasing due to policy shifts hindering access to legal protection. Between March 20 and April 30, 170,200 Afghans arrived from Iran. The combined returns from Pakistan and Iran, exceeding 300,000 in April alone, are placing “extreme pressure” on Afghanistan’s border regions and urban areas ill-equipped for such large movements, the IFRC concluded. Published in Dawn, May 26th, 2025

data.title: Journalist, official among 23 dead in Israeli strikes
data.description: • Gaza authorities say Israel in control of 77pc of territory • Man whose nine children killed battling for life in ICU CAIRO: Israeli military strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Sunday, including a journalist and a rescue service official, health authorities said. The latest deaths resulted from Israeli strikes in Khan Yunis, Jabalia and Nuseirat areas, medics said. In Jabalia, local journalist Hassan Majdi Abu Warda and several family members died when an air strike hit his house. The air strike in Nuseirat killed Ashraf Abu Nar, a senior official in the territory’s civil emergency service, and his wife in their house, medics added. There was no immediate comment by the Israeli military. The Hamas-run Gaza government media office said Abu Warda’s death raised the number of Palestinian journalists killed in Gaza since October 7, 2023, to 220. In a separate statement, the media office said Israeli forces were in control of 77 per cent of the Gaza Strip, either through ground forces or evacuation orders and bombardment that keeps residents away from their homes. Islamic Jihad, a wing of Hamas, said that fighters had carried out ambushes and attacks using bombs and anti-tank rockets against Israeli forces in several areas across Gaza. Meanwhile, the father of nine children killed in an Israeli strike in Gaza over the weekend remains in intensive care, said a doctor at the hospital treating him. Hamdi Al-Najjar, himself a doctor, was at home in Khan Yunis with his 10 children when an Israeli air strike occurred, killing all but one of them. He was rushed to the nearby Nasser Hospital in southern Gaza where he is being treated for his injuries. Abdul Aziz Al-Farra, a thoracic surgeon, said Najjar had undergone two operations to stop bleeding in his abdomen and chest and that he sustained other wounds including to his head. “May God heal him and help him,” Farra said, speaking by the bedside of an intubated and heavily bandaged Najjar. Hamdi Al-Najjar, a wounded Palestinian father and doctor who according to medics lost nine of his children in an Israeli strike, lies in a hospital bed in the Intensive Care Unit at Nasser Hospital after being injured in the same strike, in Khan Younis, Gaza on May 25, 2025. — Reuters/Hatem Khaled The Israeli military confirmed it conducted an air strike on Khan Yunis on Friday. The military is looking into claims that “uninvolved civilians” were killed, it said, adding that the forces had evacuated civilians from the area before the strike began. According to medical officials in Gaza, the nine children were aged between one and 12 years. The child that survived, a boy, is in a serious but stable condition, the hospital said. Najjar’s wife, Alaa, also a doctor, was not at home at the time of the strike. She was treating Palestinians injured in Israeli attacks on Gaza in the same hospital where her husband and son are receiving care. “She went to her house and saw her children burned, may God help her,” said Tahani Yahya Al-Najjar of her sister-in-law. “With everything we are going through only God gives us strength.” Tahani visited her brother in hospital on Sunday, whispering to him that she was there: “You are okay, this will pass.” Published in Dawn, May 26th, 2025

She was treating Palestinians injured in Israeli attacks on Gaza in the same hospital where her husband and son are receiving care. “She went to her house and saw her children burned, may God help her,” said Tahani Yahya Al-Najjar of her sister-in-law. “With everything we are going through only God gives us strength.” Tahani visited her brother in hospital on Sunday, whispering to him that she was there: “You are okay, this will pass.” Published in Dawn, May 26th, 2025

data.title: Lahore Qalandars pull off incredible chase to clinch third HBL PSL title
data.description: LAHORE: Sikandar Raza ran off in celebration — punching the air in delight, his partner Kusal Perera in tow as fireworks exploded in the background. Lahore Qalandars were Pakistan Super League champions again, sealing their third title in four seasons after pulling off a remarkable chase. Quetta Gladiators had been in the ascendancy in Sunday’s final, headed towards what they believed was their destiny — a second PSL crown — having clinched their first six long years ago. They had tightened the noose around the Qalandars, who, in their chase of 202, needed 57 runs to win off the last 20 deliveries when Raza joined Perera at the crease. But the Qalandars found inspiration, as Gladiators lost theirs; Perera played a masterful knock of an unbeaten 31-ball 62 featuring four sixes and five fours, with Raza providing the ideal foil with 22 off seven balls to take their side home with a ball to spare. As their teammates ran onto the pitch in jubilation, the Gladiators sank to the ground, left wondering what could have been. Raza, who had flown in from England after featuring for Zimbabwe in a four-day Test that only ended on Saturday and only arrived 10 minutes before the toss for the final, began the recovery when he deposited the first two balls he faced for a four and a six. The hits, both in the mid-wicket region, came immediately after Mohammad Amir had dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa to put the Gladiators on top. Perera, Raza star in nerve-jangling last-over victory against Quetta Gladiators to seal third title in four seasons Perera launched the offensive from the other end; the left-hander — who only came into the Qalandars’ side after the PSL was halted with eight games to go due to Pakistan-India skirmishes — hit Khurram Shahzad for two sixes and then punished Amir in the penultimate over for two fours and a slog-sweep for six. That left Qalandars needing 13 off the final over and Raza came to the fore after Hasan Nawaz, who had earlier scored 76 for Gladiators, acrobatically saved a boundary. The Zimbabwean slashed an audacious six over point and then used his wrists to spark Qalandars’ celebrations in front of a partisan home crowd. Qalandars skipper Shaheen Shah Afridi ran to lift Raza on his shoulders. The pacer — who was the pick of Lahore’s bowlers with 3-24 — had given his side the ideal start in the final when he dismissed his Gladiators counterpart Saud Shakeel early on. Saud’s opening partner Finn Allen departed in the third over, but Hasan checked Qalandar’s building momentum. On the first six balls he faced, Hasan got two fours and a massive six over long-on. Rilee Roussow, at the other end, was also dealing in boundaries; his first three scoring shots being two fours and a pull off Haris Rauf for six. The left-hander then found joy on the off side, getting two fours in the sixth over by Salman, and the Gladiators ending the powerplay at 57-2. Rossouw, however, fell soon after, with Raza striking as the South African found Shaheen at short cover. Losing his partner didn’t stop Hasan, though. Rishad Hossain was belted for two fours off the first three balls of the eighth over. Raza was then deposited for six in the next over before Hasan took Rishad to the cleaners in the 10th with 6, 4, 4 off the first three balls to raise his 50 off just 21 balls as Gladiators got to 100-3 at the midway point of their innings. Avishka Fernando (29) hit five fours before becoming Rishad’s first victim, but Hasan — seemingly struggling with an injury — kept going on, using brute force to dispatch Raza over his head for six more and he got lucky when he was spilled by Fakhar Zaman two overs later. Dinesh Chandimal chipped in with 22, hitting two sixes, before holing Shaheen to substitute Mohammad Azab on the second ball of the 18th over with Hasan’s 43-ball knock ending four deliveries later when he found Raza at wide long-on. Haris returned to dismiss Amir and Abrar Ahmed as Gladiators seemed to crumble late on, but Faheem Ashraf (28 not out) pulled and flicked Salman for three sixes in the final over to take his side to 201-9. Mohammad Naeem (46) got Qalandars off to a flier in their chase, bludgeoning Faheem for two sixes, but just when he was threatening to take it away from the Gladiators single-handedly, he saw his partner Fakhar trapped lbw by Abrar. Naeem survived after Usman Tariq dropped a sitter and with Abdullah Shafique crunching a glorious late cut for four off Abrar, Qalandars reached 56-1 by the end of the powerplay. Naeem hit six sixes in his 27-ball innings, which ended when Faheem had him caught at deep square, bringing Perera to the crease. Abdullah made 41 off 28 with four fours and a six, but after he top-edged Usman to be caught in the 13th over, the Gladiators seemed to have reined in the Qalandars, who needed 71 off the last five overs. Rajapaksa never got going, but his dismissal only paved the way for Qalandars’ stunning late charge. Published in Dawn, May 26th, 2025

data.title: Democracy not doing so well, military rule not alternative — Zamani Lekwot
data.description: GENERAL Zamani Lekwot (retd) served as the Military governor of old Rivers State from July 1975 to July 1978 during the military administrations of Generals Murtala Muhammed and Olusegun Obasanjo. On 15 May 1992, when violence erupted between the Muslim Hausa and Christian Atyap communities of Zango-Kataf  Local Government Area in Kaduna State over trading and land ownership rights, with many deaths, a tribunal set up by the General Ibrahim Babangida government sentenced Lekwot and 16 others to death for alleged complicity in the killings. The post Democracy not doing so well, military rule not alternative — Zamani Lekwot appeared first on Vanguard News .

data.title: INTERVIEW - «Wir hörten den Vater plötzlich brüllen, sahen Blut und begriffen erst da: Mein Vater hatte sich mit einem Beil den kleinen Finger abgehackt»
data.description: Die italienische Schriftstellerin Dacia Maraini war 1943 mit ihren Eltern in ein japanisches Internierungslager deportiert worden. Im Gespräch mit Roman Bucheli erzählt sie von der grausamen Haft, als sie fast verhungerten und eine mutige Tat ihres Vaters sie rettete.
data.translatedTitle: Interview - "We suddenly heard the father roaring, saw blood and terms only there: my father had chopped his little finger with a hatchet»
data.translatedDescription: The Italian writer Dacia Maraini was deported to a Japanese internment camp with her parents in 1943. In conversation with Roman Bucheli, she tells of cruel imprisonment when she almost starved and a brave act of her father saved her.

data.title: GASTKOMMENTAR - Der Westen hat sich mit der Durchsetzung einer regelbasierten Weltordnung stark verausgabt – er muss sich neu aufstellen
data.description: Mit Donald Trumps Rückkehr ins Weisse Haus kommt die globalisierte Weltordnung noch stärker ins Rutschen. Der Westen erkennt mehr und mehr, dass er seine Kräfte überspannt hat. Der Idealismus hält der Wirklichkeit nicht stand, not tut eine Besinnung auf das Eigene.
data.translatedTitle: Guest commentary - the West has been very spent by enforcing a rule -based world order - it has to reorganize it
data.translatedDescription: With Donald Trump's return to the White House, the globalized world order gets even more slipping. The West recognizes more and more that it has spanned its strength. The idealism does not stand up to reality, need to reflect on your own.

data.title: GASTKOMMENTAR - Ein Weckruf für eine bessere politische Grundbildung
data.description: Demokratie ist keine Selbstverständlichkeit. Ihre Grundwerte müssen der Jugend vermittelt werden. Die Volksschule sollte den Geschichtsunterricht wieder neu aufbauen.
data.translatedTitle: Guest comment - a wake -up call for better basic political education
data.translatedDescription: Democracy is not a matter of course. Their basic values ​​must be conveyed to the youth. The elementary school was supposed to rebuild history lessons.

data.title: KOMMENTAR - Nimmt man die Verfassung, die EU-Verträge und die Demokratie ernst, führt kein Weg am Ständemehr vorbei
data.description: Der Bundesrat will in der Europafrage den Weg des geringeren Widerstands gehen und auf das Ständemehr verzichten. Das Parlament sollte anders entscheiden – wie bei der EWR-Abstimmung.
data.translatedTitle: Comment - If you take the constitution, EU contracts and democracy seriously, there is no way around the stand
data.translatedDescription: In the European question, the Federal Council wants to go the path of lower resistance and do without the stem. The parliament should decide differently-as with the EEA vote.

data.title: DER ANDERE BLICK - Wenn NGO schon Geld vom Staat erhalten, müssen die Bürger genau wissen, wofür und warum
data.description: Die «Initiative Transparente Demokratie» will Nichtregierungsorganisationen gründlich unter die Lupe nehmen. Das ist eine interessante Idee, denn zu oft wird reiner Aktivismus als gemeinnütziges Engagement verkauft.
data.translatedTitle: The other look - if NGO already receives money from the state, citizens have to know exactly what and why
data.translatedDescription: The “Transparent Democracy Initiative” wants to take a closer look at non -governmental organizations. This is an interesting idea, because too often pure activism is sold as a non -profit commitment.

data.title: Tag der Entscheidung für Sebastian Kurz – USA gewähren EU bei angedrohten neuen Zöllen einen Monat Aufschub – Trumps Zollpolitik verändert das Denken der Top-Manager
data.description: Wir starten mit Ihnen in den Nachrichtentag und geben Ihnen einen schnellen Überblick über die wichtigsten Themen des Morgens.
data.translatedTitle: Day of the decision for Sebastian Kurz-the USA grant EU for a month in threatened new tariffs-Trump's customs policy changes the thinking of the top managers
data.translatedDescription: We start the news day with you and give you a quick overview of the most important topics of the morning.

data.title: Trump gewährt EU bei angedrohten neuen Zöllen Aufschub
data.description: Ab dem 1. Juni sollten neue Zölle in Höhe von 40 Prozent auf Waren aus der EU eingeführt werden, drohte der US-Präsident. Nach einem „sehr netten“ Gespräch mit Kommissionspräsidentin Ursula von der Leyen hat er diese nun bis zum 9. Juli ausgesetzt. Bis dahin wolle man „schauen, ob wir eine Lösung finden können“.
data.translatedTitle: Trump grants the EU in the event of threatened new tariffs
data.translatedDescription: From June 1st, new tariffs of 40 percent should be introduced to goods from the EU, the US President threatened. After a "very nice" conversation with Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, he has now suspended it until July 9th. Until then, one wanted to "see if we can find a solution".

data.title: Wie Trumps Zollpolitik das Denken der Firmenchefs verändert  [premium]
data.description: Trumps erratische Zollpolitik hält die Weltwirtschaft heuer in Atem. Der US-Präsident schickt nicht nur die Finanzmärkte auf Achterbahnfahrt, sondern beeinflusst das Denken der Wirtschaftstreibenden in Europa deutlich, zeigt eine BCG-Studie.
data.translatedTitle: How Trump's customs policy changes the thinking of the company bosses [Premium]
data.translatedDescription: Trump's erratic customs policy keeps the global economy in suspense this year. The US President not only sends the financial markets on the roller coaster ride, but also significantly influences the thinking of the economic operators in Europe, shows a BCG study.

data.title: Live ab 9 Uhr: Wird der Schuldspruch für Sebastian Kurz rechtskräftig?
data.description: Hat Ex-Kanzler Sebastian Kurz seine Rolle bei der Bestellung des Aufsichtsrats der Staatsholding Öbag heruntergespielt? Er bestreitet das und hat Berufung gegen das Urteil des Erstgerichts – acht Monate bedingte Haft – eingelegt. Heute entscheidet das Oberlandesgericht Wien. Die „Presse“ berichtet live.
data.translatedTitle: Live from 9 a.m.: Will the guilty verdict for Sebastian Kurz be final?
data.translatedDescription: Has ex-chancellor Sebastian Kurz played down his role in ordering the Supervisory Board of State Holding ÖBAG? He denies this and has appealed against the judgment of the initial court - eight months due to imprisonment. Today the Higher Regional Court of Vienna decides. The "press" reports live.

data.title: Russland greift Ukraine auch über Nacht wieder mit Drohnen an
data.description: Das russische Militär versucht, die ukrainische Flugabwehr mit dem Einflug größerer Gruppen von Drohnen zu überlasten. Im ganzen Land ertönt Luftalarm.

data.translatedDescription: The Russian military tries to overload the Ukrainian air defense with the entry of larger groups of drones. Air alarm sounds throughout the country.

data.title: USA gewinnen nach Jahrzehnten wieder Eishockey-WM
data.description: Die USA gewannen mit 1:0 gegen Österreich-Bezwinger Schweiz und holten sich damit ihren dritten WM-Titel. Schweden entschied das Spiel um Platz drei gegen Dänemark klar für sich.
data.translatedTitle: The USA will win ice hockey World Cup again after decades
data.translatedDescription: The United States won 1-0 against Austria-converter Switzerland and thus won its third World Cup title. Sweden clearly won the game for third place against Denmark.

data.title: Deutsch-französischer Regisseur Marcel Ophüls gestorben
data.description: Marcel Ophüls setzte sich in seinen Filmen kritisch mit der Geschichte des Nationalsozialismus auseinander und wollte insbesondere den Mythos des französischen Widerstands gegen die deutschen Besatzer widerlegen. Nun ist der Deutsch-Franzose im Alter von 97 Jahren gestorben.
data.translatedTitle: Franco-German director Marcel Ophüls died
data.translatedDescription: In his films, Marcel Ophüls critically dealt with the history of National Socialism and in particular wanted to refute the myth of French resistance against the German occupiers. Now the German-French has died at the age of 97.

data.title: Sędzia Hermeliński: Kampania nie usprawiedliwia nienawistnych poglądów

Osoby, które chcą pełnić urząd prezydenta RP powinny odpowiadać za swoje czyny tak jak wszyscy inni obywatele – uważa Wojciech Hermeliński, sędzia Trybunału Konstytucyjnego w stanie spoczynku, b. przewodniczący Państwowej Komisji Wyborczej.
data.translatedTitle: Judge Hermeliński: The campaign does not justify hateful views

People who want to perform the office of the President of the Republic of Poland should be responsible for their actions like all other citizens - believes Wojciech Hermeliński, judge of the constitutional Tribunal at rest, former chairman of the State Electoral Commission.

On Sunday evening, the President of the EC informed about the phone call on the X network, stating that the European Union needs time until July 9 to achieve a good agreement. Trump agrees with the proposal, said Truth Social at night.

data.title: Review: ‘The Eternaut’ — compelling post-apocalyptic sci-fi from Argentina
data.description: DUBAI: At first, it seems like “The Eternaut” is going to be a climate-crisis-focused piece. It’s summer and Buenos Aires is boiling in more ways than one — demonstrations against government incompetence rage on the streets while power cuts only increase the oppressive heat felt by residents. Then a sudden fall of deadly radioactive snow kills hundreds of thousands instantly.

data.title: Trump says he wants to ‘end conflicts not start them’
data.description:
DOHA: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said he wanted to "end conflicts not start them" as he addressed troops at the United States' sprawling Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar.

	Trump visited a US base installation at the center of American involvement in the Middle East as he uses his four-day visit to Gulf states to reject the “interventionism” of America’s past in the region.
data.translatedTitle: Trump says he wants to ‘end conflicts not start them’

data.title: Egypt approves $221m of oil exploration deals with foreign firms
data.description:
RIYADH: Egypt has approved $221 million worth of deals with foreign firms for oil exploration and exploitation in the Western Desert and Gulf of Suez.

	A statement issued following a meeting of the country’s Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly, said ministers had signed off on five draft petroleum commitment agreements.

	The deals involve the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp., the Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., and a group of international oil companies.
data.translatedTitle: Egypt approves $221m of oil exploration deals with foreign firms

	The deals involve the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp., the Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co., and a group of international oil companies.

data.title: IEA forecasts slowdown in global oil demand growth for the rest of 2025
data.description:
LONDON: The International Energy Agency said on Thursday economic headwinds combined with record sales of electric vehicles will reduce global oil demand growth to 650,000 barrels per day for the remainder of 2025.

	That marks a slowdown from the 990,000 bpd the IEA measured for demand growth over January-March.

	“Increased trade uncertainty is expected to weigh on the world economy and, by extension, oil demand,” the IEA said in its May oil market report.
data.translatedTitle: IEA forecasts slowdown in global oil demand growth for the rest of 2025

	“Increased trade uncertainty is expected to weigh on the world economy and, by extension, oil demand,” the IEA said in its May oil market report.

data.title: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.description:
RIYADH: Rent increases and fuel price rises helped Saudi Arabia post an inflation rate of 2.3 percent in April — the same level as a year earlier — official data showed.

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.
data.translatedTitle: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.translatedDescription:

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.

data.title: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
data.description:
MANCHESTER: Erling Haaland said Manchester City must deliver in the FA Cup final on Saturday to salvage something from a “horrific” season that saw them deposed as English champions for the first time in five years.
	City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola’s debut season in charge in 2016/17.
	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.
data.translatedTitle: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season

data.title: Ben Sulayem drives major improvements to FIA’s international Sporting Code
data.description: DUBAI: The Federation Internationale de l’Automobile, the global governing body for motor sport and the federation for mobility organizations worldwide, has announced that it is to make major improvements to Appendix B of its International Sporting Code following an extensive review commissioned by FIA’s President Mohammed Ben Sulayem.

data.title: Russian delegation arrives in Turkiye for Ukraine war talks
data.description:
ISTANBUL: Russia’s delegation arrived in Istanbul for peace talks with Ukraine, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said Thursday, and a Ukrainian official said a delegation including President Volodymyr Zelensky was on its way the the Turkish capital Ankara.

	Russian President Vladimir Putin was not part of the delegation from Moscow, however, according to a list released by the Kremlin Wednesday night, prompting criticism from Western officials that the Kremlin isn’t serious about the peace effort.

data.title: Lufthansa group suspends Tel Aviv flights following Houthi attacks on Israel
data.description:
BERLIN: Airline group Lufthansa will suspend its flights to Tel Aviv through May 25, it said on Thursday, citing the “current situation.”
	This affects flights operated by Lufthansa, Swiss, Austrian Airlines, Eurowings, ITA Airways, Brussels Airlines and Lufthansa Cargo, it added.
	Global airlines have again halted their flights to and from Tel Aviv after a missile fired by Yemen’s Houthis toward Israel on May 4 landed near the country’s main international airport in Tel Aviv.

data.title: Al-Ain to host 6th IMMAF Youth World Championships in July
data.description:
ABU DHABI: The UAE Jiu-Jitsu and Mixed Martial Arts Federation has announced that the sixth IMMAF Youth World Championships will be held in Al-Ain Region for the first time from July 21-27.

	The tournament will be staged at the Al-Ain Convention Center with more than 1,000 male and female athletes from 60 countries competing in the championship’s largest event to date.

data.description: El mandatario estadounidense aceptó la solicitud de la presidenta de la Comisión Europea tras una llamada telefónica y extiende la suspensión de aranceles a la UE.

data.translatedDescription: The American president accepted the request of the president of the European Commission after a telephone call and extends the suspension of EU tariffs.

data.title: Trump está molesto con Putin por ataques rusos en Ucrania y medita imponer sanciones a Moscú
data.description: Donald Trump criticó este domingo los últimos ataques rusos sobre Ucrania, porque el presidente Vladímir Putin "está matando a mucha gente".

data.title: Urgen designar director del Sistema Penitenciario, luego de muerte de reos
data.description: El deceso de cuatro reos el pasado fin de semana más el aumento de la criminalidad en determinadas áreas puede estar asociada a la ausencia del director del Sistema Penitenciario, al no ejercerse controles en los reclusorios, según especialistas.
data.translatedTitle: They are urgent to designate director of the penitentiary system, after inmate death

data.title: Olimpia arrasa y conquista su copa 39 con goleada memorable al Real España
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras .- El viejo león volvió al trono para reclamar ese sitio que prestó por seis meses el torneo pasado. La bailada que le dio al Real España será recordada porque lo hizo ver tan pequeño de tal forma que no compitió. La Copa 39 está en casa, don Eduardo Espinel transformó las críticas de inicio de torneo en gloria y lo devolvió jugando con señorío. Y es que las finales nadie las recuerda por jugar bonito, sino por la contundencia. El 2-1 del partido de ida fue simplemente la antesala de lo que este 25 de mayo terminó en una fiesta inolvidable. Los cuatro fantásticos volvieron cuando más lo esperaban. José Mario Pinto volvió a ser determinante, gol y asistencia, Julián Martínez demostró que ya no es promesa, es realidad; Jerry Bengtson apareció para dar tranquilidad y Michaell Chirinos, simplemente le puso el lustre al pastel. El estadio Nacional se vistió de gala para extender la alfombra roja al viejo león. El ambiente con el que la afición empujaba al equipo rápidamente se trasladó al terreno de juego porque José Mario Pinto se levantó para conectar el primer gol de la noche. Apenas iban 15 minutos de partido y la copa 39 tomaba forma. Dixon Ramírez colaboró agachándose y darle plenitud a su vuelo. La Máquina tuvo que hacer cambios, Jeaustin Campos se dio cuenta de que se equivocó. Con el ingreso de Bryan Moya hicieron fuerzas y tras un error de Carlos Pineda, que entregó un pase mal, llegó en barrida Moya para empatar el partido. Pero la alegría fue de pobre, apenas dos minutos después vino otro error de Buba López que se convirtió en Santa Claus haciendo regalos adelantados. Una salida en falso, dejó con amplias posibilidades a Julián Martínez, que de cabeza, como en la ida, comenzaba a encaminar el campeonato blanco. Terminó el primer tiempo y solo había un equipo en la cancha. Olimpia se adueñó del duelo y cuando salieron al complemento, volvió a tener otro regalito de la noche. Una mano de Amfronit Tatum, le daba la posibilidad a Bengtson que transformó en gol el penal para enterrar todos los sueños. El Nacional rugía y hasta se dieron el gusto de pedir jugadores y hacer la ola. La Máquina acabó por sucumbir cuando Michaell Chirinos clavó la estocada final al meterse en el área tras un pase fenomenal de José Mario Pinto. Allí terminó el trabajo de Jeaustin Campos que nunca compitió y se va del Real España sin gloria. Así, el león se bañó de gloria en una tarde donde el joven Julián Martínez salió con lentes oscuros simulando a Lamine Yamal para recibir el trofeo MVP de la final, y dedicando todo su éxito a su amigo fallecido, Demetri Gordon. data.title: Menjívar dedica título a los críticos: "Estuvieron escribiendo tonteras en redes"
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras .- El portero del Olimpia , Edrick Menjívar, fue claro con sus palabras tras ganar el título del torneo Clausura de la Liga Nacional. Menjívar se refirió a los que criticaron al Olimpia cuando tuvieron un bajón en el torneo. "El torneo pasado teníamos para hacer historia, nos dolió mucho perder esa copa, sabíamos que la tendríamos en este torneo, le queríamos dar la bienvenida al profe, fue un torneo difícil, nos costo´bastante, pero aquí estamos", comenzó diciendo Mejívar. Siguió. "Se nos criticó bastante pero nosotros siempre mantuvimos la calma, tenemos grandes jugadores, tuvimos la oportunidad para callar a los que estuvieron escribiendo tonteras en redes sociales", dijo a Deportes TVC al finalizar el partido. ¿Tonteras? "Sí, que estábamos haciéndole la cama al profe, son cosas que nada que ver, el equipo siempre mantuvo la calma, tenemos jugadores que aparecen en estos momentos y quedó demostrado". También se refirió a lo difícil que fue el inicio del torneo. "Sabíamos que al inicio nos iba a costar, solo tuvimos dos semanas de pretemporada, nos tocó enfrentar a equipos ya armados como Motagua y Real España, ellos juegan muy bien, sabíamos que nos iba a costar, pero confiamos en los jugadores que aparecen en etapas finales", cerró.
data.translatedTitle: Menjívar dedicates a title to critics: "They were writing nonsense in networks"
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras .- Olimpia's goalkeeper, Edrick Menjívar, was clear with his words after winning the title of the Clausura National League tournament. Menjívar referred to those who criticized Olympia when they had a downturn in the tournament. "The last tournament had to make history, it hurt a lot to lose that cup, we knew we would have it in this tournament, we wanted to welcome the teacher, it was a difficult tournament, cost us, but here we are," he began to say Mejívar. He continued. "We were criticized a lot but we always kept calm, we have great players, we had the opportunity to silence those who were writing nonsense on social networks," TVC told Sports at the end of the game. Fools? "Yes, we were making the bed to the teacher, they are things that nothing to do, the team always kept calm, we have players who appear at the moment and was demonstrated." He also referred to how difficult the beginning of the tournament was. "We knew that at the beginning it was going to cost us, we only had two weeks of preseason, we had to face already armed teams such as Motagua and Real España, they play very well, we knew that it was going to cost us, but we trust the players that appear in final stages," he closed.

data.title: Chirinos marcó el 4-1 para el Olimpia y liquidó la final contra Real España
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- El atacante Michaell Chirinos se encargó de cerrar con broche de oro la gran final del torneo Clausura 2025 entre Olimpia y Real España , anotando el cuarto gol del partido de vuelta en el Estadio Chelato Uclés. El "33" del equipo merengue aprovechó una buena asistencia otorgada por su compañero José Mario Pinto. Una vez que el balón lo tuvo en sus pies, se quitó la marca del zaguero aurinegro Devron García, acomodando su pierna izquierda para enviar el balón hacia el costado derecho de la portería de Luis "Buba" López. Es así como en el minuto 78 Chirinos sentenció el partido 4-1, asegurando el título número 39 para "Los Leones", ampliando la marca del club como el máximo ganador de la Liga Nacional. Inmediatamente y lleno de alegría, Michaell Chirinos corrió a festejar, recibiendo la ovación de los aficionados y de sus compañeros con quienes gozará de una gran celebración al levantar la 39 liga.
data.translatedTitle: Chirinos scored 4-1 for Olimpia and liquidated the final against Real España
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- Atacker Michaell Chirinos was responsible for closing with a brooch of gold the grand final of the Clausura 2025 tournament between Olimpia and Real España, scoring the fourth goal of the second leg at the Chelato Uclés stadium. The "33" of the Merengue team took advantage of good assistance granted by his partner José Mario Pinto. Once the ball had it on his feet, the mark of the Aurinegro Devron García defender was removed, accommodating his left leg to send the ball to the right side of the goal of Luis "Buba" López. This is how in the 78th minute Chirinos sentenced the 4-1 match, ensuring title number 39 for "Los Lions", expanding the club's brand as the top winner of the National League. Immediately and full of joy, Michaell Chirinos ran to celebrate, receiving the ovation of the fans and their teammates with whom he will enjoy a great celebration when he lifted the 39 League.

data.title: Los ganadores de la Liga Nacional en 59 años de historia; Olimpia levanta la 39
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- Este domingo -25 de mayo- la Liga Nacional tuvo un nuevo campeón en 59 años de historia , consagrándose como el ganador del Clausura 2025, el Olimpia tras vencer a Real España y obteniendo así su título número 39 de primera división. El fútbol hondureño cambió a su formato a profesional al fundarse lo que hoy conocemos como la Liga Nacional de Fútbol Profesional de Honduras el 10 de mayo de 1964. La primera temporada, 1965-66, fue ganada por el Platense de Puerto Cortés. Desde entonces, el fútbol de primera división en Honduras ha tenido una serie de variaciones. Algunos torneos se desarrollaban de forma clásica, en donde el equipo que obtenga más puntos en la jornada, se convierte en campeón, pero entre los años 70 a 90 se implementó el sistema liguilla. Fue a partir de 1997 que se implementó el sistema de dos torneos cortos anuales, conocidos como Apertura y Clausura. A lo largo de más de cinco décadas, solo ocho equipos han conseguido la hazaña de volverse campeones de la Liga Nacional, siendo los máximos campeones Olimpia y Motagua. Conozca todos los ganadores de la Liga Nacional de Honduras a través de la historia, desde Platense como el primer ganador hasta el título más reciente de Olimpia en el Clausura 2025.
data.translatedTitle: The winners of the National League in 59 years of history; Olimpia lifts the 39
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- This Sunday -25 of May- the National League had a new champion in 59 years of history, consecrating as the winner of the Clausura 2025, the Olympia after beating Real Spain and thus obtaining its title number 39 of the First Division. Honduran football changed to its professional format by founding what we know today as the National Professional Soccer League of Honduras on May 10, 1964. The first season, 1965-66, was won by the Platense of Puerto Cortés. Since then, First Division football in Honduras has had a series of variations. Some tournaments were developed classically, where the team that obtains more points in the day, becomes champion, but between the 70s to 90 the Liguilla system was implemented. It was from 1997 that the system of two annual short tournaments was implemented, known as opening and closure. Throughout more than five decades, only eight teams have achieved the feat of becoming champions of the National League, being the top Olympia and Motagua champions. Know all the winners of the National League of Honduras throughout history, from Platense as the first winner to Olimpia's most recent title in Clausura 2025.

En una emocionante final disputada en el Estadio Nacional Chelato Uclés de Tegucigalpa, el club Olimpia se alzó con la copa del Torneo Clausura 2025 , sumando así un nuevo título a su gloriosa historia. El equipo dirigido por Eduardo Espinel logró imponerse ante su histórico rival y celebró a lo grande junto a miles de aficionados que colmaron las gradas y vivieron el partido con pasión en todo el país. Con este triunfo, Olimpia alcanza su copa número 39 , reafirmando su lugar entre los grandes del fútbol nacional.
